com.clarionmedia.infinitum.orm.criteria.criterion
Class Conditions

java.lang.Object
  com.clarionmedia.infinitum.orm.criteria.criterion.Conditions

public class Conditions
extends java.lang.Object

Provides static factory methods for creating new Criterion to add to Criteria queries. Criterion act as conditions to restrict or refine the result sets of queries. They generally are not constructed directly but rather obtained through this class. However, it is possible to create new types of Criterion in which case they would need to be instantiated directly.

Version:
1.0 02/18/12
Author:
Tyler Treat

Conditions

public Conditions()
Method Detail

eq

public static BinaryExpression eq(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                  java.lang.Object value)
Returns a new Criterion placing an "equals" condition on the Field with the given name.

For example, to query for all models whose Field "foo" has a value "bar", calling Conditions.eq("foo", "bar") would essentially be the equivalent of doing WHERE foo = 'bar' in a SQL query.

Parameters:
fieldName - the name of the Field to place the restriction on
value - the value of the Field
Returns:
a Criterion matching this condition

ne

public static BinaryExpression ne(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                  java.lang.Object value)
Returns a new Criterion placing a "not equal" condition on the Field with the given name.

For example, to query for all models whose Field "foo" has a value other than "bar", calling Conditions.ne("foo", "bar") would essentially be the equivalent of doing WHERE foo <> 'bar' in a SQL query.

Parameters:
fieldName - the name of the Field to place the restriction on
value - the value of the Field
Returns:
a Criterion matching this condition

public static BetweenExpression between(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                        java.lang.Object low,
                                        java.lang.Object high)
Returns a new Criterion placing a "between" condition on the Field with the given name.

For example, to query for all models whose Field "foo" has a value between 0 and 42, calling Conditions.between("foo", 0, 42) would essentially be the equivalent of doing WHERE foo BETWEEN 0 and 42 in a SQL query.

Parameters:
fieldName - the name of the Field to place the restriction on
value - the value of the Field
Returns:
a Criterion matching this condition

in

public static InExpression in(java.lang.String fieldName,
                              java.lang.Object[] values)
Returns a new Criterion placing an "in" condition on the Field with the given name.

For example, to query for all models whose Field "foo" has the value 2, 4, 6, or 8, calling Conditions.in("foo", new Integer[] 2, 4, 6, 8)} would essentially be the equivalent of doing WHERE foo IN (2, 4, 6, 8) in a SQL query.

Parameters:
fieldName - the name of the Field to place the restriction on
value - the value of the Field
Returns:
a Criterion matching this condition

Returns a new Criterion placing a "like" condition on the Field with the given name.

For example, to query for all models whose Field "foo" has a value containing "bar", calling Conditions.like("foo", "%bar%") would essentially be the equivalent of doing WHERE foo LIKE '%bar%' in a SQL query.

Parameters:

For example, to query for all models whose Field "foo" does not have the value null, calling Conditions.isNotNull("foo") would essentially be the equivalent of doing WHERE foo IS NOT NULL in a SQL query.
